valid_articles.Description: Numerous SEOs are reporting that the link report in Google Search Console is showing significantly fewer links than it did a month prior.

valid_articles.Title: Google Image search adds "see exact image" that helps you find who is stealing your images

valid_articles.Description: TikTok launched a new creator program aimed at attracting creators through social impact initiatives, potentially helping the platform retain Gen Z users and attract brand growth amidst uncertainty.

valid_articles.Title: WTF is principal media?
valid_articles.Description: The use of principal media, where agencies act as media owners, is increasing, particularly among agency holding companies seeking new revenue streams. The article explores client perspectives on this trend.

valid_articles.Title: AI Briefing: Why WPP is adding Anthropic's Claude models to its AI platform
valid_articles.Description: WPP is integrating Anthropic's Claude AI models into its AI platform. The article highlights the importance of AI model selection for companies developing marketing and other AI-driven applications.

valid_articles.Title: Which of all of your site's queries actually trigger AI Overviews?
valid_articles.Description: A tweet highlighting ZipTie, a tool that helps identify search queries triggering Google's AI Overviews in bulk. The tool offers insights for content optimization based on AI Overview appearances.

valid_articles.Title: I've updated my Google AI Overviews (AIO) Traffic Risk Impact Assessment Sheet to make it easier to
valid_articles.Description: An updated Google AI Overviews (AIO) Traffic Risk Impact Assessment Sheet is available. The sheet helps assess the impact of AIO on CTR and traffic, identify featured pages, and prioritize content optimization.

valid_articles.Title: Just an update on this. Yep, the link card is still gone. So using 'preview controls' to remove content AND links from AI Overviews seems to work as intended. You can read more in my case study below.
valid_articles.Description: Using "preview controls" to remove content and links from Google's AI Overviews appears to be effective. The tweet links to a case study exploring this further.

valid_articles.Title: 30 stories over the weekend about the embarrassing and sometimes harmful Google AI Overviews - I am sure there are more - I posted them at seroundtable.com/embarrassing-g…
valid_articles.Description: A compilation of 30 stories highlighting embarrassing and potentially harmful instances of Google's AI Overviews. The tweet suggests that there are likely more such cases.

valid_articles.Title: Amazon Marketplace Fears
valid_articles.Description: The article discusses the reliance of thousands of merchants on Amazon's marketplace for revenue and the inherent fears associated with this dependency.

valid_articles.Title: Focus on YouTube? Timestamps are coming to AFT violation communications -> ⚠️Time Coded! Incredible news from the Advertiser Friendly Guidelines (AFG) team! Over the coming weeks, they’ll be rolling out time stamps "In other words, they’ll provide the point in a video where any…
valid_articles.Description: YouTube is introducing timestamps to Advertiser Friendly Guidelines (AFG) violation communications. This means creators will receive specific time codes for violations, improving transparency and clarity.

valid_articles.Title: Yep, I mentioned the impact to tutors last week when OpenAI showed off GPT-4o -> AI tutors are quietly changing how kids in the US study, and the leading apps are from China "Now, the arrival of AI bots is posing a threat to long-established tutoring franchises such as Kumon,…
valid_articles.Description: The tweet discusses the impact of AI tutors on the education sector, highlighting the rise of AI-powered tutoring apps, particularly from China, and the potential threat they pose to traditional tutoring services.

valid_articles.Title: A week ago, I had a long conversation with @thomasgermain about how Google Search dictates the shape of the web. At one point, I said that Google wields its power irresponsibly. Thomas wrote a must-read article examining whether that might be the case.
valid_articles.Description: Discussion on Google's influence on the web and potential irresponsible use of power, with a link to an article by Thomas Germain on the topic.

valid_articles.Title: Google had a year to test the AI overviews results and here we are, major media now covering their bad quality. It seems that most of their concerns were about their monetization viability and impact rather than the quality. Now major publications are covering it. And no,…
valid_articles.Description: Commentary on Google's AI-generated search overviews receiving negative coverage from major media outlets due to quality concerns, despite Google's focus on monetization.

valid_articles.Title: Let’s see if finally Google sees is not an SEO complain but from the broader public to fix it. Sad thing that it would take the @nytimes to cover it for them to actually address it
valid_articles.Description: Expresses hope that Google will address issues with its search results due to public pressure and coverage from major publications like The New York Times, rather than just SEO complaints.
